alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Gibson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 18 at 6:31PM CDT until July 18 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of West Tennessee, including the following counties, Carroll, Chester, Crockett, Decatur, Gibson, Haywood, Henderson and Madison. * WHEN...Until 930 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 631 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jackson, Humboldt, Milan, Lexington, Trenton, Natchez Trace State Forest, Natchez Trace State Park, Fairview, Alamo, Bells, Parsons, Three Way, Decaturville, Sardis, Blue Goose, Bargerton, Mifflin, Parkers Crossroads, Wildersville and Reagan. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
